trans-unit.source: Specifies constants that indicate how the entity body of an HTTP request has been read.
The entity body has been read into a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> object by using the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.GetBufferedInputStream"></xref> method.
The entity body has been read into a <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> object by using the <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.GetBufferlessInputStream"></xref> method.

The entity body has already been read and its contents have been put into HTTP request collections like <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Form"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.Files"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.InputStream"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Web.HttpRequest.BinaryRead(System.Int32)"></xref>.
Classic mode applies when ASP.NET pipeline processing has already occurred.

For example, running an ASP.NET page or accessing a property in one of the HTTP request collections causes the entity body to be read, and the entity body contents are then put into the appropriate collection.
The entity body has not been read.
